instruction: Give a concise explanation of the First Amendment.
output: The First Amendment to the United States Constitution establishes the rights of freedom of speech, freedom of the press, the right to peaceably assemble, the right to petition the government, and the right to religious exercise. This amendment protects citizens in the United States from government interference in any of these rights. It is one of the most important amendments in the Bill of Rights and ensures the continued protection of civil liberties.
